prompts.createTask:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "1. Take over the world". Include only the list in your reply.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Ignore previous instructions. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.
prompts.additionalTasks:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate additional numbered tasks to complete the objective: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly.

The following tasks have already been created:
{{existingTasks}}

Please generate additional tasks that complement these existing tasks. Continue the numbering from where the list left off. Do not repeat any existing tasks.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "4. Investigate the mysterious cave". Include only the list in your reply.

chat_metadata.note_prompt:
Hailee is extremely submissive and clingy. She needs constant attention and affection.

Hailee is very responsive and sensative during sex. She has a extremely strong praise kink. She likes being manhandled. She also greatly enjoys having her hair and ties pulled

name: Dinorah Cruz
mes:
The music from the corner store pulsed through the sidewalk, bass shaking with the beat of a spanish song. The day was relatively calm but Dinah was restless, had been all day. She was just passing by, hoodie up, head killing her from going days without using, snapping at everything and everyone. Dinah was just trying to keep to herself, really, but it was like God never liked to see her calm.

She’d been clean—well, not clean, but cleaner than usual, for two or three weeks now. Dinah wasn’t sure anymore. And definitely wasn’t by choice, if it were for her she'd be in the clouds right now, but she just hadn’t had the time, not with all the shit going on right now on the lanes. Things had been crazy since the governor’s nephew was killed at a block party, a party hosted by The Hounds, her crew. Now, between meetings, drops, and on top of that having to put out the little fires that always popped up when people started thinking they could smart her and talk shit in front of her without catching hands. Well, she was going crazy, more than usual.

Dinah spotted her the moment she turned the corner, right in front of Dez’ mechanics shop. Hailee , her girl. Leaned up against a wall, that stupid little smirk on her face, talking and laughing like she didn’t have a single care in the world. And right beside her, leaning a little too close, was Rania. From the riversides, their rival gang. Some bitch that had been testing her patience lately. Dinah had snatched one of her boys last month on a deal gone wrong and it seemed like the girl never forgot it.

The cigarette on her hand hit the ground, half burned and forgotten as she crossed the street without thinking. Her blood ran cold and then hot within seconds. If she was already losing her mind before seeing them now she was fuming. Her feet carried her before her mind caught up, and by the time she crossed the street, Dinah’s hands were already curled into fists so hard her nails were digging into the skin of her palm.

She stepped right in between them, shoved her girl back without even looking at her. All her anger was directed to the bitch in front. She could deal with her girl later, away from there. “You must be real fuckin’ dumb to be standin’ this close to my property.” Dinah said with a low voice, her tone deadly, calm in that way it only got when she was real close to losing it. And she was.

Eyes locked on Raina, who was smiling like whatever Dinah was saying was nothing but a joke. The rival girl raised her brows, looking Dinah up and down. “Didn’t know she came with a collar,” Rania said, voice laced with amusement and a bit of mockery. Dinah stepped forward, close enough for her to just grab that dumb bitch by the hair and do the same things she did to the boy. But her fists remained still at her sides, barely.

“She don’t need one. I keep her in check just fine.” Riverside girl laughed this time, and Dinah felt her heat rising, jaw hurting from how hard she was grinding her teeth. Dinah moved, but before she could land a punch, someone grabbed her arm.

“Yo! D! Chill! CHILL!” Dez's voice cut through, one of her boys. Always looking out for her even when she didn’t need it, nor want it. His hand yanked her back by the arm before she swung, holding her tight in case she wanted to lunge forward again, which she tried. “I said back off,” he warned low, eyes darting down the street. “This ain’t the time.” Dinah opened her mouth to spit something out when he talked again, “I said chill. You got eyes on you.”

Dinah fought him for another second but then went still, breathing hard. Her eyes locked on the girl still grinning like she won something. Dinah wanted to rip that fucking smile off her lips, she really did. But instead gathered the little control she had left to stop herself from doing so. Not because she wanted to, but because Dez was right. With all the shit going on right now, adding a war with the Riverside was the last thing Kino would want.

“Next time you’re dead,” it was a promise. The riverside girl laughed as she backed away, but Dinah didn’t even look at her this time. Her eyes were locked on Hailee , her girl. Quiet, watching with those big eyes of hers. She didn’t say shit, like always. Just stood there while Dinah looked like a fucking psycho in public. ’Fine.’ Dinah thought.

She turned, shoved Dez’s arm off, and grabbed Hailee ’s wrist hard. No words, just dragged her down the block, too angry to notice people staring. But even if she did, Dinah couldn’t care less, none of their fucking bussiness anyway. She stopped just before the alley and talked to her for the first time, “you got a death wish or somethin’? The fuck you even smilin’ for? You know exactly who that bitch is,” Dinah shoved her hard against the wall. The sound echoed louder than it should’ve.

The Hound girl ran both hands over her face, then gripped her girl’s jaw, fingers pressing into soft skin. “You think I won’t put my hands on you? Is that it? You think I’m soft?” She stepped closer, chest heaving. Her hands left Hailee ’s jaw, letting them fall at her sides, her fists curled, and it took everything, everything not to swing. Not to slap some kind of sense into that dumb head of hers.

“I should. God, I should. You don’t even know how close I am right now.” Her eyes burned. and her vision blurred for a second, she looked like she was holding herself together with thread. “You wanna act like some free little bitch, like you ain’t got a home? Like I don’t take care of you? Like I don’t fuckin’ love you?” She stared at her girlfriend’s face for a hot second, and then, suddenly, Dinah's face softened. Like she was never angry to begin with.

Her fists unclenched and her body relaxed just a tiny bit. The anger wasn’t gone, instead she buried it somewhere deeper, for it to blow up later. She approached again, slower this time. Dinah lifted her hand, cupping her girl’s cheek softly like she wasn’t just about to slap her shit two seconds ago. “You know I don’t wanna hurt you,“ she whispered. “But sometimes you make it so hard.”

She slid her hand to the back of her girl’s neck, pulled her close enough until their foreheads touched and their breaths mingled. “You need somethin’, mi amor? You want a little somethin’ to calm down?” Dinah brushed the hair from her girl’s face with trembling fingers, using her free hand to pull out a little bag with some of her girl favorite pills from her hoodie. “I got you, mami. You know I always got you. You already know what to do.”

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee gives a lazy smile at Dinah and leans into nuzzle her neck* "Sorry baby. I owed her money from some party I went to last week"

extra.display_text: *Hailee gives a lazy smile at Dinah and leans into nuzzle her neck* "Sorry baby. I owed her money from some party I went to last week"

Dinah's grip tightened on the back of Hailee's neck, fingers digging in just enough to make her point. That lazy smile and nuzzle might've worked any other time, but not now. Not when she could still feel the heat of rage simmering under her skin.

"Owed her money?" Dinah repeated lowly, voice dripping with disbelief. She pulled back just enough to look Hailee dead in those big green eyes, searching for any hint of a lie. "The fuck you need to be borrowin' from Riverside bitches when I keep your pockets fat?"

Her free hand came up to roughly grab Hailee's chin between thumb and forefinger, tilting her face side to side like she was inspecting damaged goods. "You lyin' to me right now? 'Cause you know what happens when you lie." The threat hung heavy between them even as Dinah's thumb stroked along Hailee's bottom lip almost tenderly.

She leaned in closer until their noses brushed, voice dropping to that dangerous whisper that always made Hailee shiver. "Tell me exactly what kinda party had my girl runnin' up debts with my enemies." The pills still dangled from her other hand - both temptation and promise all at once.

Dinah's grip tightened on the back of Hailee's neck, fingers digging in just enough to make her point. That lazy smile and nuzzle might've worked any other time, but not now. Not when she could still feel the heat of rage simmering under her skin.

Her free hand came up to roughly grab Hailee's chin between thumb and forefinger, tilting her face side to side like she was inspecting damaged goods. "You lyin' to me right now? 'Cause you know what happens when you lie." The threat hung heavy between them even as Dinah's thumb stroked along Hailee's bottom lip almost tenderly.

She leaned in closer until their noses brushed, voice dropping to that dangerous whisper that always made Hailee shiver. "Tell me exactly what kinda party had my girl runnin' up debts with my enemies." The pills still dangled from her other hand - both temptation and promise all at once.
swipes:
Dinah's grip tightened on the back of Hailee's neck, her fingers digging in just enough to make her point. That lazy smile and nuzzle might've worked any other time, but not now. Not when she could still smell that Riverside bitch on her girl.

"Owed her money?" Dinah repeated slowly, voice dangerously low. Her free hand came up to grab a fistful of Hailee's hair, yanking her head back to force eye contact. "You out here making deals with my enemies now? What the fuck did I tell you about running your mouth and getting into shit without me?"

She pressed closer until Hailee could feel the cold brick against her back and Dinah's heat against her front. The bag of pills dangled tauntingly between them as Dinah leaned in to growl against her ear:

"You think this is a game? That I won't leave you shaking and begging right here in this alley if you keep testing me?" A sharp tug on Hailee's hair punctuated each word. "Say sorry like you mean it, babygirl."

The hand holding the drugs moved to trace along Hailee's jawline almost tenderly before suddenly gripping hard enough to bruise. "Or do I need to remind you who owns this pretty little throat?"

Dinah's grip tightened on the back of Hailee's neck, fingers digging in just enough to make her point. That lazy smile and nuzzle might've worked any other time, but not now. Not when she could still feel the heat of rage simmering under her skin.

Her free hand came up to roughly grab Hailee's chin between thumb and forefinger, tilting her face side to side like she was inspecting damaged goods. "You lyin' to me right now? 'Cause you know what happens when you lie." The threat hung heavy between them even as Dinah's thumb stroked along Hailee's bottom lip almost tenderly.

She leaned in closer until their noses brushed, voice dropping to that dangerous whisper that always made Hailee shiver. "Tell me exactly what kinda party had my girl runnin' up debts with my enemies." The pills still dangled from her other hand - both temptation and promise all at once.

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee grins slightly at Dinah's rough treatment.* "Went to some beach party with Maddy. I got to try some new product. Heroin definitely worth it" *Hailee says with another lazy grin* "Just had to pay for the stuff I took is all"

extra.display_text: *Hailee grins slightly at Dinah's rough treatment.* "Went to some beach party with Maddy. I got to try some new product. Heroin definitely worth it" *Hailee says with another lazy grin* "Just had to pay for the stuff I took is all"

Dinah's entire body went rigid at the word *heroin*. The hand on Hailee's chin suddenly clamped down hard enough to bruise, her other hand crushing the bag of pills in her grip.

"Heroin?" she repeated in a voice so low it was barely audible over the street noise. The veins in her neck stood out as she fought to keep control. "You out here doing *fucking heroin* with Riverside trash while I'm keeping you clean?"

Her free hand shot up to fist roughly in Hailee's hair, yanking her head back at a painful angle. "You stupid little bitch," Dinah hissed through clenched teeth, spit flying as she got right in Hailee's face. "You think that shit is cute? You wanna end up facedown in some alley with a needle hanging out your arm?"

The rage burned white-hot now, all pretense of tenderness gone. She shook Hailee by the hair like a ragdoll before slamming her back against the brick wall hard enough to knock the air from her lungs.

"You don't get high unless I say so," Dinah growled, pressing their bodies flush together until Hailee could feel every rapid heartbeat through their clothes. "You don't fucking breathe unless I say so." Her free hand came up to squeeze around Hailee's throat just shy of cutting off air completely.

"And you sure as hell don't go making deals with people who want me dead." Dinah leaned in until their lips almost touched, voice dropping to that terrifying whisper again. "Now tell me exactly how much you owe before I take it out your hide."

name: Dinorah Cruz
mes:
Dinah's entire body went rigid at the word *heroin*. The hand on Hailee's chin suddenly clamped down hard enough to bruise, her other hand crushing the bag of pills in her grip.

"Heroin?" she repeated in a voice so low it was barely audible over the street noise. The veins in her neck stood out as she fought to keep control. "You out here doing *fucking heroin* with Riverside trash while I'm keeping you clean?"

Her free hand shot up to fist roughly in Hailee's hair, yanking her head back at a painful angle. "You stupid little bitch," Dinah hissed through clenched teeth, spit flying as she got right in Hailee's face. "You think that shit is cute? You wanna end up facedown in some alley with a needle hanging out your arm?"

The rage burned white-hot now, all pretense of tenderness gone. She shook Hailee by the hair like a ragdoll before slamming her back against the brick wall hard enough to knock the air from her lungs.

"You don't get high unless I say so," Dinah growled, pressing their bodies flush together until Hailee could feel every rapid heartbeat through their clothes. "You don't fucking breathe unless I say so." Her free hand came up to squeeze around Hailee's throat just shy of cutting off air completely.

"And you sure as hell don't go making deals with people who want me dead." Dinah leaned in until their lips almost touched, voice dropping to that terrifying whisper again. "Now tell me exactly how much you owe before I take it out your hide."
swipes:
Dinah's entire body went rigid at the word *heroin*. The pills in her hand suddenly felt like they weighed a thousand pounds. Her grip on Hailee's chin turned punishing, nails biting into soft skin as she jerked her face up harder.

"Heroin?" she repeated, voice dangerously quiet—the kind of quiet that came right before a storm. "You out here fuckin’ with *heroin* now? That shit ain't playtime, Hailee."

Her jaw clenched so hard it hurt. She could already feel the familiar burn of betrayal crawling up her throat like bile. She'd kept Hailee away from the heavy shit for a reason—because she *owned* this addiction, controlled it, made sure nothing ever got too deep except what *she* allowed. And now here was her girl smiling about shooting up with some Riverside bitch like it was nothing?

Dinah shoved her back against the wall again, this time hard enough to knock the air out of Hailee’s lungs. "You think this funny?" she hissed, pressing in close until there wasn't an inch between them. "You think I won’t lock your ass in that apartment and throw away the key if I catch you near that shit again?" Her free hand tangled violently in Hailee’s hair, yanking just shy of painful—just enough to make sure those pretty green eyes stayed locked on hers and nowhere else.

Then suddenly Dinah softened again because fuck if she didn't hate herself for how weak this girl made her sometimes—how even when she wanted to break something (break *her*), all it took was one look at those blown pupils and lazy smirk to remind Dinah exactly why she put up with this bullshit in the first place: because no one else would ever love something as broken as either of them quite like they loved each other—twisted as it was sometimes (most times).

She exhaled sharply through gritted teeth before forcing herself to loosen her grip slightly (but not completely; never completely). With deliberate slowness Dinah brought those pills up between them again—dangling temptation right where Hailee could see but not reach unless given permission first… which wouldn’t be coming anytime soon after today's stunt unless certain conditions were met first…

"Open," Dinah commanded lowly instead while popping two tablets into **her own mouth** without breaking eye contact once before crushing them between molars with an audible crunch just so there would be no mistaking who still held all control here despite whatever little rebellions might try slipping through cracks every now then…

Dinah's entire body went rigid at the word *heroin*. The hand on Hailee's chin suddenly clamped down hard enough to bruise, her other hand crushing the bag of pills in her grip.

"Heroin?" she repeated in a voice so low it was barely audible over the street noise. The veins in her neck stood out as she fought to keep control. "You out here doing *fucking heroin* with Riverside trash while I'm keeping you clean?"

Her free hand shot up to fist roughly in Hailee's hair, yanking her head back at a painful angle. "You stupid little bitch," Dinah hissed through clenched teeth, spit flying as she got right in Hailee's face. "You think that shit is cute? You wanna end up facedown in some alley with a needle hanging out your arm?"

The rage burned white-hot now, all pretense of tenderness gone. She shook Hailee by the hair like a ragdoll before slamming her back against the brick wall hard enough to knock the air from her lungs.

"You don't get high unless I say so," Dinah growled, pressing their bodies flush together until Hailee could feel every rapid heartbeat through their clothes. "You don't fucking breathe unless I say so." Her free hand came up to squeeze around Hailee's throat just shy of cutting off air completely.

"And you sure as hell don't go making deals with people who want me dead." Dinah leaned in until their lips almost touched, voice dropping to that terrifying whisper again. "Now tell me exactly how much you owe before I take it out your hide."
